FuncDef:
The qos pq-scheduler priority command modifies the priority of PQ scheduling.
The undo qos pq-scheduler priority command cancels the priority of PQ scheduling on a subcard or restores the default priority of PQ scheduling on a board.
By default, a board has a default PQ scheduling priority of high, and a subcard has no default PQ scheduling priority.
CLIs: qos pq-scheduler priority { high | low } { inbound | outbound [ card <card_id> ] }
undo qos pq-scheduler priority { inbound | outbound [ card <card_id> ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the inbound direction of an interface.
-

Specifies the outbound direction of an interface.
-

Specifies the ID of a registered subcard.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When CIR-based congestion occurs, if PQ and non-PQ schedulings must be distinguished for FQs between SQs, set the priority of PQ scheduling to high; if PQ and non-PQ schedulings do not need to be distinguished for FQs between SQs, set the priority of PQ scheduling to low.
High: Packets conforming to the CIR and latency-sensitive packets share the priority value 0.Low: In all queues, packets conforming to the CIR has the priority value of 1, and packets conforming to the PIR has the priority value of 3.

Precautions
This command is supported only by the following eTM subcards: P51-E/P101-E/LPUI-51-E,P480-A/P101-A/P51-E/LPUI-51-E/P101-E/P240-E/LPUI-480-B/P52-E.
The qos pq-scheduler priority { high | low } { inbound | outbound } command is not supported on the following boards: LPUF-50/LPUF-50-L,LPUI-21-L/LPUI-51-L/LPUF-51/LPUF-51-B/LPUI-51/LPUI-51-B/LPUI-51-S/LPUS-51/LPUF-101/LPUF-101-B/LPUI-101/LPUI-101-B/LPUS-101/LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-CM/LPUF-120/LPUF-120-B/LPUF-120-E/LPUI-102-E/LPUI-120/LPUI-120-B/LPUI-120-L/LPUI-52-E/LPUI-120-E/LPUI-120-CM/LPUF-240/LPUF-240-B/LPUF-240-E/LPUI-240/LPUI-240-B/LPUI-240-CM/LPUI-240-L.
